rawLines.text: Hey everyone and welcome back to another
episode of Super Insider. Today Mark and
I sat down with Mike Ball, a product
leader who's been quietly pioneering how
PMs actually use AI tools in their
day-to-day work. In this episode, you're
going to hear how Mike went from
breaking up with Chad GPT to building
what has become one of the most powerful
workflows we've seen yet, using Claude,
floor, and MCPS, which stands for model
context protocols to build a true memory
system that lives locally on his
machine. We covered what MCPS really are
and why they're kind of like SDKs for AI
agents. And then how Mike ended up
setting up that local memory graph that
remembers his work, his family, vacation
plans, nutritional preferences for
everyone in his family, and why he
thinks rag is really broken, or at least
traditional RAG, and how knowledge
graphs are changing the entire game of
using AI. And then we're going to tie it
back to what it all means for product
teams trying to ship faster without
drowning in prompts, context switching,
or hallucinations.
If you've ever wished that your AI tools
felt more like a real teammate, I think
this episode's going to give you a real
glimpse into what's possible today and
what's coming next. Let's dive in.
